intro: Geigeria schinzii, commonly known as the African bluebottle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Geigeria schinzii is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
